author: Subhash Kak
subject: India's interaction with Africa and the possible influence of Indic beliefs on Western monotheistic traditions
summary: The author investigates the possible connection between the worship of the Sun by Akhenaten and Indic beliefs of the Mitanni. He presents evidence indicating that the famous hymn to Aten by Akhenaten was influenced by Vedic hymns, and discusses the implications of this early encounter between the Indic and Western worlds on the development of monotheistic traditions.
